alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Bullock; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Pike; Russell (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued March 13 at 2:52AM CDT until March 14 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the first Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 34 possible. For the second Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 31 possible. * WHERE...Montgomery, Macon, Bullock, Lee, Russell, Pike and Barbour Counties. * WHEN...For the first Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Tuesday morning. For the second Freeze Watch, from Tuesday evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Bullock; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Pike; Russell
